  • Dovecot_IMAPS_Integration_with_FreeIPA_using_Single_Sign_On
    • Gotcha’s
    • Add system to IPA Domain (ensure DNS is working correctly otherwise this step will fail)
    • Install Dovecot and set service to start on boot
    • Edit /etc/dovecot/dovecot.conf to allow imap
    • Edit /etc/dovecot/conf.d/10-auth.conf to configure kerberos authentication
    • Create new IPA group for mailbox access
    • Add users to “mailusers” group
    • Create new directory for user mailboxes
    • Edit /etc/dovecot/conf.d/10-mail.conf to configure the mailbox location
    • Generate a kerberos keytab for Dovecot IMAP access
    • Change the permissions of the keytab to allow Dovecot to read the file (Note, this should be kept secure, so only grant enough privileges as absolutely necessary.)
    • Restart Dovecot
    • Send a test email to your user
    • Configure Thunderbird to connect to IMAP Server
    • Verify your authentication on the Dovecot server

  • Squid_Integration_with_FreeIPA_using_Single_Sign_On
    • Add system to IPA Domain (ensure DNS is working correctly otherwise this step will fail)
    • Install Squid and set service to start on boot
    • Edit /etc/squid/squid.conf to configure kerberos authentication
    • Generate a kerberos keytab for Squid HTTP access
    • Change the permissions of the keytab to allow Squid to read the file (Note, this should be kept secure, so only grant enough privileges as absolutely necessary.)
    • Add keytab location to /etc/sysconfig/squid
    • Restart squid
    • Open Port 3128 in IPTables
    • Configure browser on IPA Client
    • Verify your configuration

  • YubiRadius_integration_with_group-validated_FreeIPA_Users_using_LDAPS
    • Step 1. Create our Group to be used for user validation
    • Step 2. Add users to your new group.
    • Step 3, Create an LDAP bind account.
    • Step 4. Add your YubiRadius server’s hostname to our DNS environment. If you are using IPA to manage your DNS, do the following.
    • Step 5. Start to configure your YubiRadius through the webmin management page.
    • Step 6. Create a domain.
    • Step 7. Import Users from FreeIPA
    • Step 8. Assign Yubikey(s) to your User(s)
    • Step 9. Verify your User’s Radius authentication.
